page.title: 03Hellesdon Grows
page.content: The shortage of building materials after World War 2 lasted until the 50's .Only the priority buildings (eg. police houses,essential public buildings) were built. The exception was Hawthorn Ave. where prefabricated homes were put up. The population of Hellesdon reached 6,359 in 1951 and E.Bush was employed in building many of the new houses and shops needed. The first post-war church in Norfolk, St.Pauls was built (1950) closely followed by the Catholic church of St. Boniface in that year. The new Junior school (now Kinsale Middle) was built in '51 as Heather Ave (since it opened in 1930) had grown to over 400 pupils. The 60's brought an increase in motor traffic, main drainage was extended to all of the parish and roads were made up.The last building surge was between 1966 and 1977.
